justification: The article states, “The drift rate reflects both people's task ability and the general ease of the task,” explicitly linking the construct of ability/ease to the drift-rate parameter used in evidence-accumulation models.
It is noted that “the decision threshold reflects how cautious people are in their decision strategy,” identifying the decision threshold parameter as the measure of response caution.

When discussing age differences, the authors explain that older adults’ slower performance was due to “slower perceptual/motor processes (i.e., higher non-decision time),” indicating that non-decision time serves as the metric for perceptual and motor speed.
